Sec. 1. Short title and table of contents.
Title I—Budget Enforcement

Title V—Higher Education

Title VI—Transportation

Sec. 602. Transportation cost reimbursement.

Title VII—Miscellaneous Provisions
Sec. 701. Extension of customs user fees.

text.#text: In order to support the provision of quality care for our nation’s seniors,

text.#text: The application and assessment of measures and other activities under SGR reform should be facilitated by the

header.#text: Simplify and Reduce Administrative Burden on Physicians

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: provide physicians with feedback on performance in as close to real time as possible. Such timely feedback will ensure that physicians can excel under a system of meaningful measurement.

text.#text: In order for measure and assessment programs to encourage the highest quality care for Medicare seniors, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: supports these efforts and encourages them to continue in the future.
also encourages the development and testing of models of specialty care.

text.#text: There is great need to test alternatives to Fee-For-Service reimbursement in the Medicare program. One option is the promotion and adoption of new models of care for physicians. To date, there has been significant development and testing of models for primary care.
